post.description:
Create a new agent. By default, creates a new version(v1) and a draft.
If is_draft is true, creates only a draft.

parameters.name: is_draft

schema.description: If true, the agent is created as a draft.
schema.title: Is Draft

parameters.description: If true, the agent is created as a draft.

get.description:
Retrieve the lists of agents of a company. By default, retrieves only draft
versions.
Retrieve a specific agent by ID. By default, retrieves the draft version.

parameters.name: version_id

schema.description: Optional version ID to retrieve a specific version of the agent.
schema.title: Version Id

parameters.description: Optional version ID to retrieve a specific version of the agent.

parameters.name: is_published

schema.description: If true, retrieves the published version of the agent.
schema.title: Is Published

parameters.description: If true, retrieves the published version of the agent.

patch.description: Update the draft of an existing agent.

post.description: Launch a new version of an existing agent, based on a draft.

get.description: List all versions of an existing agent.

delete.description: Delete a specific version of an agent by version ID.

patch.description:
Publish a specific version of an existing agent, associating it whith a phone number.
The phone numbers can be inbound, outbound or both, but at least one must be provided.
If version_id is None, unpublishes the current published version.

get.description: Retrieve a list of voices.
Retrieve a specific voice by ID.

Call-tools are built-in tools that agents can use to perform call-related
actions such as transferring calls, ending calls, etc.

schema.title: Response List Call Tools V1 Call Tool  Get

patch.description:
Change the agent associated with a phone. It requires a valid agent_version_id, that
will publish the version of that agent. If a agent has already a published version, it will
use that version instead of creating a new one.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description given to the agent

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The prompt given to the agent

greeting.title: Greeting
greeting.description: The greeting message said by the agent to the caller at the beginning of the call

time_before_start.title: Time Before Start
time_before_start.description: The time in seconds before the agent starts to speak

voice_id.title: Voice Id
voice_id.description: The voice id to be used by the agent

boosted_keywords.title: Boosted Keywords
boosted_keywords.description: he list of keywords that are boosted for the agent speech recognition. Use this to improve the agent's recognition of domain-specific terms. For example, `['bradycardia']`

language.title: Language
language.description: The language used by the agent. Use `multi` for the agent using both english and spanish in the same call (multi will expand to more languages in the future)

redirect_number.title: Redirect Number
redirect_number.description: The phone number to use by the agent if the call needs to be redirected. If not provided, you won't be able to redirect the call even if the tool is present

max_reminder_count.title: Max Reminder Count
max_reminder_count.description: The maximum number of reminders that can be sent to the caller. If not provided, the default value is 3. When reached the last reminder, the call gets hang up. Set this value to 0 to disable reminders

reminder_frequency_ms.title: Reminder Frequency
reminder_frequency_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds to send reminders to the caller. If not provided, the default value is 7500. Set this value to 0 to disable reminders

reminder_messages.title: Reminder Messages
reminder_messages.description: The list of messages to send to the caller as reminders. If not provided, the default value is an empty list which makes the model to generate the reminder messages by itself. Please, note that when using an empty list, the `reminder_frequency_ms` can be a little bit higher than specified since it has to generate the messages

knowledge_base_ids.title: Knowledge Base Ids
knowledge_base_ids.description: The list of knowledge base ids available for the agent to use

mode.title: Agent Mode
mode.description: The mode of the agent. Can be 'free' or 'path'

conversational_path_id.title: Conversational Path Id
conversational_path_id.description: The id of the conversational path used by the agent.

version_name.title: Version Name
version_name.description: The name of the created version

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.description: The list of integrations and their tools to assign to the agent

call_tools.title: Call Tools
call_tools.description: The list of call-tools (built-in tools) to assign to the agent

agent_id.title: Agent Id
agent_id.description: The unique identifier for the agent

modified_at.title: Last Update
modified_at.description: The date and time when the agent was last updated

created_at.title: Creation Date
created_at.description: The date and time when the agent was created

version_id.description: The version id of the agent

version_name.description: The version name of the agent

description.description: The description given to the agent

time_before_start.title: Time Before Start
time_before_start.description: The time in seconds before the agent starts to speak

voice.title: Voice

boosted_keywords.title: Boosted Keywords
boosted_keywords.description: he list of keywords that are boosted for the agent speech recognition. Use this to improve the agent's recognition of domain-specific terms. For example, `['bradycardia']`

language.title: Language
language.description: The language used by the agent. Use `multi` for the agent using both english and spanish in the same call (multi will expand to more languages in the future)

redirect_number.title: Redirect Number
redirect_number.description: The phone number to use by the agent if the call needs to be redirected. If not provided, you won't be able to redirect the call even if the tool is present

max_reminder_count.title: Max Reminder Count
max_reminder_count.description: The maximum number of reminders that can be sent to the caller. If not provided, the default value is 3. Set this value to 0 to disable reminders

reminder_frequency_ms.title: Reminder Frequency
reminder_frequency_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds to send reminders to the caller. If not provided, the default value is 7500.

reminder_messages.title: Reminder Messages
reminder_messages.description: The list of messages to send to the caller as reminders. If not provided, the default value is an empty list which makes the model to generate the reminder messages by itself. Please, note that when using an empty list, the `reminder_frequency_ms` can be a little bit higher than specified since it has to generate the messages
